result.execSummary:
The defendant Justice H Blackhawk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Daniel McGrath in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justice H Blackhawk in court.  Attorney Richard E. Bender in court for Justice H Blackhawk. 
Attorney McGrath gives the court his sentencing recommendation and puts the defendants previous convictions on the record. Attorney Bender makes a statement regarding sentencing. Defendant makes a statement to the court.
Final pre-trial on July 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justice H Blackhawk in court.  Attorney Richard E. Bender in court for Justice H Blackhawk. 
Not guilty pleas are entered. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Justice H Blackhawk appeared in court, Attorney David R. Knaapen for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
Officer Klein is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being a police officer with the Marshfield Police Department. Testifies to being dispatched to a residence for a report of a disturbance where a knife was possibly used towards another individual. Testifies to speaking with TLS regarding the incident that happened. Testifies to TLS stated the defendant was highly intoxicated and started throwing items around the residence. Testifies to stating the defendant held a knife up to TLS's throat. Testifies to TLS stating the defendant was mumbling but heard the defendant say "just like this" when the defendant was holding the knife. 
Officer Klein identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. 
Testifies to how TLS said he was able to get away from the defendant. Testifies to efforts made to get the defendant out of the residence. Testifies to officers surrounding the residence, having to call and text the defendant, and use a PA to speak with the defendant. Testifies to the defendant eventually answering the door. Testifies to finding the knife in the residence. Testifies to the defendant being the only person in the residence at that time. 
Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. 
Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Absolute sobriety. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. No contact with victim or their residence. $2000
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on March 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Absolute sobriety, do not enter any establishments that sell or serve alcohol. No contact w/victim or their residence
